chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge plus costs while on Supervision in Count 2.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Be supervised by the Mental Health unit of the Probation department

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the stipulated amount of $200.00 payable to Alice V.    If defendant is revoked, Court orders monies taken by the DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, with balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay all costs and surcharges (including those in Counts 1 & 4); should defendant get revoked, monies to be taken by the DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Unpaid balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in  civil judgment.

Obtain and maintain employment. 
Be given job and vocational training
Defendant advised of firearms restrictions and voting ineligiblity

NO CONTACT with Monisha H or Alice V.
NO CONTACT with the McDonald's restaurant located at 420 E. Capitol Dr.  
NO alcohol.
NO controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for the defendant's mental or physical needs by a duly licensed pyhsician.

Provide DNA sample unless previously provided.  
Undergo Mental Health evaluation;  follow through with any recommended treatment.  
Stay on any medication regiment ordered.  
Take all medications as prescribed.   
Congive Thinking Intervention counseling.    
Parenting classes/ counseling.
AODA assessment and treatment;  Urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamal Antwan Hardy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (51 pages) commencing 10-29-2014 GUILTY PLEA/ SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended  Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant is now charged as follows:

COUNT 01: Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500), a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a)

COUNT 02:Attempt Theft From Person, an attempt to commit a Class G Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e) and 939.32

COUNT 03:  Disorderly Conduct, a Class B Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 947.01(1).

COUNT 04:  Obstructing/Resisting an Officer, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 946.41(1).
Case passed to 10/29/14 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Francisco Araiza appeared in court on behalf of attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales, defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has a pending revocation hearing set for 9/30/14; parties request a plea date after that.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Branch 20 is not in session on 8/22/14.  Case is rescheduled to 9/16/14 at 8:30 a.m.
Defendant currently has a VOP hold on him.  Once VOP is lifted, Court ordered cash bail to revert to $5,000.00 CASH.

Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court had colloquy with defendant who agreed with findings in report and believes he is competent to assist his attorney at trial.  Defense counsel also agrees her client is competent to proceed and so does the State.  Proceedings are reinstated.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/filed.
Faxed report dated 7/02/14, filed.

Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant stated to the court he did not feel he was competent to proceed.  Defense raised issue of competency.   Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the the Department of Health and Family Services.  Order for Competency Examination by DHFS, signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department for transport to a State mental health facility for examination.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 20 on 7-30-2014 at 1:30 pm.
Doctor's report, received and filed

Attorney Francisco Araiza appeared on behalf of attorney Reyna I Morales in court, defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy not in court, in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel informs the Court that on behalf of Ms. Morales, he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed; as well, defense counsel requested that defendant also be examined for NGI, 971.16(1).  Per 971.14(2), Court ordered proceedings suspended.  Forensic Unit was contacted.  Dr. John Pankiewicz has been appointed by the Court, as requested by parties.  Forensic Unit indicated to this clerk that they would assign a doctor (either Dr. Pankiewicz or another member of their office) to do the competency exam.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report before Branch 20.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna I Morales in court, defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy not in court, in custody.  Defense counsel wishes to raise issue of competency. Case adjourned to 5/15/14 at 1:30 p.m. for scheduling conference.

Attorney Adam Galavez appeared on behalf of Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel needs an offer.  Case is continued before Branch 20 for scheduling.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Alice V., Monisha H., MC DONALD'S located at 420 E. Capitol Dr. and BURGER KING located at 2862 N. Martin Luther King Dr., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Jamal Antwan Hardy in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 1, 3 and 4.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
